name: GNU Global
description: Source code tagging tool which works with C. GNU GPL3

name: gprof
description: Performance analysis tool. Part of GNU binutils. GNU GPL3 or later

name: Highlight
description: Converts source code to formatted text with nice highlighting. GNU GPL3

name: include-what-you-use
description: Helps find unecessary inclusions and make suggestions for fixing them. Based on LLVM/Clang (and only works with it). NCSA

name: indent
description: Formats C source code automatically to make it easier to read. Also converts from one style of source to another. GNU GPLv3 or later

name: rr
description: Debugger that records non-deterministic executions to allow for deterministic debugging. FreeBSD

name: tup
description: Very fast, file-based, cross-platform build system. GNU GPL2.1

name: unifdef
description: Removes #ifdef and #if directives with their delimited text without touching any other part of the file. 3-clause BSD and FreeBSD

name: Valgrind
description: Range of dynamic analysis tools, including a leak checker. GNU GPL2.1

name: ApeTagLibs
description: C library for working with APEv2 tags. Expat

name: bfd
description: Library for manipulating binary object files. Part of GNU binutils. GNU GPL3 or later

name: cf4ocl
description: The C Framework for OpenCL; a cross-platform object-oriented framework for developing and benchmarking  OpenCL projects. GNU LGPL3 (library) or GNU GPL3 (project code)

name: CommonMark
description: C implementation of the CommonMark spec. Various Licenses

name: CException
description: C implementation of exceptions. Expat

name: docopt.c
description: C implementation of a command-line option parser. Expat

name: dyncall
description: Another foreign function interface library. Expat

name: FANN
description: Fast Artifical Neural Network library; an implementation of neural networks. GNU GPL2.1

name: Firm
description: C library that provides a graph-based intermediate representation, optimizations and assembly code generation suitable for use in compilers. Comes with an example C front-end under the same license. GNU LGPLv2.1

name: Genann
description: Simple neural network library in C. Zlib

name: gjrand
description: Library of random-number generation routines. GNU GPL2.1 or GNU GPLv3

name: GNU FreeIPMI
description: In-band and out-of-band IPMI implementation. GNU GPL3

name: GNU gperf
description: Perfect hash function generator, given a list of strings. Outputs C code. GNU GPL3 or later

name: GNU Libffcall
description: Collection of libraries for building foreign function interfaces. GNU GPL3 or later

name: gperftools
description: Collection of utilities for measuring and improving performance. 3-clause BSD

name: huffandpuff
description: Minimal Huffman encoder and decoder. Public Domain

name: kdtree
description: Simple library for working with KD-trees. 3-clause BSD

name: Kitsune
description: Efficient, general-purpose framework for dynamic software updating. GNU LGPL3 or later

name: libavl
description: Library containing a range of self-balancing binary trees. GNU GPL3 or later

name: libbson
description: BSON utility library. Apache 2.0

name: libCello
description: Library introducing higher-level programming to C. 3-clause BSD

name: libffi
description: Portable foreign-function interface library. Expat

name: libgit2
description: Pure C implementation of Git. GNU GPL2 only, with a linking exception

name: libimobiledevice
description: Cross-platform protocol library to communicate with iThings. GNU LGPLv2.1 or later (library) or GNU GPL2.1 or later (tools)

name: libnfc
description: Platform-independent Near-Field Communication library. GNU LGPL3

name: libPhenom
description: Deprecated, here for archival purposes. Eventing framework for building high-scalability and high-performance systems. Apache 2.0

name: ncurses
description: Coloured terminal UI library. GNU GPL3 or later

name: nope.c
description: C-language-based, ultra-light software platform for scalable server-side and networking applications (think node.js for C programmers). GNU GPL2.1

name: pbc
description: Protocol buffers library. Expat

name: rabbitmq-c
description: Client library for RabbitMQ. Expat

name: Ragel
description: DSL for state machines that compiles to C. GNU GPL2.1

name: Tinyexpr
description: Tiny recursive-descent parser, compiler and evaluation engine for simple mathematical expressions. zlib

name: uthash
description: Hash table implementation, allowing existing structures to be stored in a hash table easily. 1-clause BSD

name: cpu_features
description: A cross platform C99 library to get cpu features at runtime. Apache 2.0

name: pblog
description: Small, low overhead, structured logging library intended for logging formware events.Apache 2.0

name: libelf
description: ELF object file access library in C. GNU GPL2.1

name: mcpp
description: Portable C preprocessor. 2-clause BSD

name: libusb
description: Generic access to USB devices. LGPL2.1

name: alsa-lib
description: Userspace library to interact with ALSA. LGPL2.1

name: Capstone
description: Dissasembly/disassembler framework. BSD 3-clause

name: Expat
description: Stream-oriented XML parser. Expat

name: libxml2
description: Standards-compliant, portable XML parser. Expat

name: mini-xml
description: Small XML reading and writing library. No dependencies aside from C standard library. Apache 2.0 with exceptions
